sections.title: Account setup
sections.description: Learn about setting up your account and verifying domain ownership for Google Workspace.

questions.question: Typically how long after new features are released to the Rapid release track will they be released on the Scheduled release track?
questions.shortQuestion: Delay between Rapid and Scheduled release?
answers: At least 2 weeks
At least 4 months
At least 1 week
At least 1 month
questions.note: Remember: Scheduled release gives admins time to prepare. It's longer than just a week!

questions.question: What must you do before you can start to use Google Workspace services?
questions.shortQuestion: First step before using Google Workspace?
answers: Configure MX records to point to Google.
Provide Google with proof of identity.
All these.
Verify that you own the domain that you want to associate with Google Workspace.
questions.note: Tip: Google needs to be sure you actually control the domain before allowing services!

questions.question: What type of DNS record allows receiving mail servers to verify that the sending servers are authorized to send mail on your domain’s behalf?
questions.shortQuestion: DNS record to verify authorized sending servers?
answers: Mail Exchanger (MX) record.
Sender Policy Framework (SPF) record.
Google Site Verification record.
CNAME (Alias) record.
questions.note: Hint: Think about verifying 'who can send emails' — not who receives them.

questions.question: How does GCDS sync directory information?
questions.shortQuestion: How does GCDS sync directories?
answers: It updates Google Workspace with information from the local LDAP directory.
It updates the local LDAP directory with Google Workspace information.
It provides a two-way sync that relies on object modified dates to determine which directory wins.
GCDS is used for provisioning only.
questions.note: Focus: GCDS is about pushing your local directory data to Google, not the other way around.

questions.question: What is the minimal amount of characters required of Google Workspace passwords?
questions.shortQuestion: Minimum password length?
answers: 12 characters
8 characters
6 characters
10 characters
questions.note: Think basic security standards: not too long, but still secure enough.

questions.question: When adding users individually, how are passwords established?
questions.shortQuestion: How are passwords set when adding users individually?
answers: The admin can enter a password manually or allow the console to generate a temporary password for the new user.
Admins need to upload a default password to Google Workspace before adding any users.
Google Workspace requires the admin to manually add passwords for every single user that is added to the domain.
None of these.
questions.note: Hint: Google gives flexibility to admins when setting initial passwords.

questions.question: Which of the following are required when adding multiple users via a CSV file? (Choose 2)
questions.shortQuestion: Required fields for CSV user upload?
answers: Password
Middle Name
First Name
Home Address
Job Title
questions.note: Reminder: Focus on basic credentials needed to create a user account.

questions.question: Your company just acquired a 100-employee startup and you quickly need to add the new employees to your domain. Using the Admin console, which is the most efficient way to add new users all at once?
questions.shortQuestion: Most efficient way to add many users?
answers: Have them create their own accounts with the “Invite users” option.
Add the new users manually
Add all the new users at once from a .csv file.
Use GCDS to provision your new users.
questions.note: Hint: Think bulk upload — a simple file can save a lot of time!

sections.title: Organizational Units and Settings
sections.description: Understand how settings are inherited across OUs and how to manage access based on organizational structure.

questions.question: How do settings inherit across OUs?
questions.shortQuestion: How are settings inherited across OUs?
answers: All settings are the same for each level within the organizational hierarchy.
You must manually configure the settings for each new organizational unit you add to your account.
All settings for all OUs, no matter the hierarchy, start out the same.
Each child OU inherits settings from its parent, which you can then customize.

questions.question: Which of these statements are true about Google Workspace OUs? (Choose 2)
questions.shortQuestion: Which statements are true about Workspace OUs?
answers: OUs are comprised of groups.
A user may belong to multiple OUs.
A Google Workspace account may contain multiple OUs.
A user may belong to one OU only.

questions.question: You want to enable Blogger for your full-time employees but restrict access to your contractors. Which method could be used to do this?
questions.shortQuestion: How can you restrict Blogger for contractors?
answers: Move the contractors into an OU and turn off Blogger for that OU.
Restrict access to Blogger in the Blogger profile for each contractor.
Disable the Blogger service in the user profile for each contractor.
Create a Google group, add the contractors to the group, and turn off Blogger for the group.

sections.title: Admin Role Management
sections.description: Learn how to assign admin roles, manage privileges, and create custom roles for effective user management.

questions.question: When assigning an administrative role to a single user, where in the user's account page do you assign the role?
questions.shortQuestion: Where do you assign admin roles in a user's account?
answers: License
Security
Groups
Admin roles and privileges

questions.question: You can assign more than one administrator role to a user.
questions.shortQuestion: Can a user have multiple admin roles?
answers: True
False

questions.question: Privileges in a pre-built administrator role can be customized.
questions.shortQuestion: Can pre-built admin role privileges be changed?
answers: True
False

questions.question: What’s the recommended way to create a custom administrator role for your domain?
questions.shortQuestion: How should you create a custom admin role?
answers: Create a new role and choose the required privileges.
Choose the custom administrator option when manually adding the user.
Duplicate an existing role and edit the privileges.
Create a new role based on a role template.

sections.title: Gmail Basics
sections.description: Understand the basics of calendar settings and management.

questions.question: Which of the following settings cannot be set from the Gmail service settings?
questions.shortQuestion: Setting not controlled in Gmail service?
answers: Allow users to set Gmail themes
Allow users to delegate access to their mailbox
Default language
Name format
questions.note: Review Exercise #1 - Configure common user settings.

questions.question: Which of the following actions can be taken on a message when an attachment compliance rule is matched? (Choose 3)
questions.shortQuestion: Actions for attachment compliance rule?
answers: Deliver message
Quarantine message
Reject message
Modify message
questions.note: Only 3 actions are correct: Deliver, Quarantine, Reject.

questions.question: Which of these settings do the users control from their Gmail settings? (Choose 2)
questions.shortQuestion: User controls in Gmail?
answers: Display language for the Gmail interface
Add POP3 accounts to the user’s inbox
Create a personal email alias
Name format (e.g., First, Last)
questions.note: Users manage their display language and add POP3 accounts.

sections.title: Calendar Basics
sections.description: Understand the basics of calendar settings and management.

questions.question: Which Calendar settings can an administrator control for everyone in the organization? (Choose 2)
questions.shortQuestion: Admin control settings?
answers: Highest level of external sharing for primary calendars
Time zone selections for calendar display
Access to individual calendar labs
Default level of internal sharing for primary calendars
Calendar delegation to other users

questions.question: What are Calendar Resources? (Choose 2)
questions.shortQuestion: Calendar resources?
answers: Bookable equipment
Calendar dates
Bookable conference rooms
Contacts

questions.question: What can users control when it comes to their Calendar?
questions.shortQuestion: User Calendar controls?
answers: Users control what they share internally
Users control what they share externally from their secondary calendars
Users control what they share externally from their primary calendar
Users can create their own resources

questions.question: What are recommended to be configured before adding resources to the organization? (Choose 2)
questions.shortQuestion: Setup before adding resources?
answers: Buildings
Locations
Features
Groups to provide access to each resource

sections.title: Drive and Docs
sections.description: Assessment covering Drive sharing defaults, file recovery, ownership transfer, external sharing protections, and shared drive management.

questions.question: Your company wants to adopt the policy that new documents will be shared internally with everyone in the company. What’s the recommended way to set this up?
questions.shortQuestion: Default internal sharing setup?
answers: Have users save their docs to a Google Group that everyone belongs to
Change Link Sharing Defaults to 'ON - Primary target audience with the link'
Have users save their docs to a shared drive that everyone belongs to
Have users save their docs to a My Drive folder that is shared with everyone
questions.note: The correct method is to change Link Sharing Defaults to internal sharing.

questions.question: A user left your company last month and you deleted their Google Workspace account 15 days ago. You have been contacted as the administrator and asked if you can recover the deleted user's documents. What should you do?
questions.shortQuestion: Recover deleted user's documents?
answers: Advise the requester that you cannot restore a deleted user's files.
Restore the files from the deleted user's account
Restore the user, transfer the files to a new owner, and delete the user again.
Advise the requestor that 14 days after account deletion, all data is purged so you cannot recover any documents
questions.note: If within 20 days, restore the user, transfer files, then delete again.

questions.question: From which places can you transfer file ownership from one user to another? (Choose 2)
questions.shortQuestion: Ways to transfer file ownership?
answers: From the user's My Drive folder
From the Drive and Docs service settings page
The user's profile in the admin console
When deleting a user from the admin console
questions.note: File ownership transfer is available from Drive and Docs settings or during user deletion.

questions.question: Your company allows external sharing of documents but your CEO is concerned about how documents are shared externally. As the administrator, which additional protections might you put in place? (Choose 2)
questions.shortQuestion: Protections for external sharing?
answers: Require a Google sign in when viewing a shared file
Enable the feature that warns users when sharing outside the organization
Allow users to share publicly
Ensure users are only allowed to share with users in the global directory
questions.note: Use warning and sign-in requirements to enhance external sharing security.

questions.question: Which of the following actions can you NOT take as administrator from the Managed shared drives area in the admin console?
questions.shortQuestion: Action NOT possible in Managed shared drives?
answers: Manage members
View drive contents
Restore a deleted drive or files
Delete a shared drive
Manage shared drive sharing settings
questions.note: Admins cannot restore deleted drives or files from Managed shared drives view.
